statement:
The successive positive integers 8 and 9 are integer powers of positive
integers ($2^3$ and $3^2$), with exponents greater than 1. [*Catalan’s
conjecture*]{} (1844) said that there are no other such successive
positive integers, i.e. that the only integer solution of the
Diophantine equation $$x^m-y^n = 1$$ with $x > 1$, $y > 1$, $m > 1$,
$n > 1$ is $$x = n = 3, \quad y = m = 2.$$

It took more than 150 years before the conjecture was proven. Mihailescu
gave in 2002 a proof in which he used the theory of cyclotomic fields
and Galois modules.
